content: In a year, some months have 30 days, while some have 31. How many have 29?

All months have at least 28 days, and in a leap year, February has 29 days. In a common year, only February has 29 days if it's a leap year. But in a non-leap year, no month has 29 days. So, in a leap year, one month has 29 days, and in a non-leap year, no month has 29 days.
